Generation I.Red: The female's horn develops slowly. Prefers physical attacks such as clawing and biting.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: The female's horn develops slowly. Prefers physical attacks such as clawing and biting.
Generation I.Yellow: When resting deep in its burrow, its thorns always retract. This is proof that it is relaxed.
Generation I.Stadium: The female is usually docile. However, if it becomes enraged, it will attack wildly with bites and scratches.

Generation II.Gold: When feeding its young, it first chews and tenderizes the food, then spits it out for the offspring.
Generation II.Silver: It has a calm and caring nature. Because its horn grows slowly, it prefers not to fight.
Generation II.Crystal: It has a docile nature. If it is threatened with attack, it raises the barbs that are all over its body.
Generation II.Stadium 2: When feeding its young, it first chews and tenderizes the food, then spits it out for the offspring. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) It has a calm and caring nature. Because its horn grows slowly, it prefers not to fight. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: When Nidorina are with their friends or family, they keep their barbs tucked away to prevent hurting each other. This Pok é mon appears to become nervous if separated from the others.
Generation III.Sapphire: When Nidorina are with their friends or family, they keep their barbs tucked away to prevent hurting each other. This Pok é mon appears to become nervous if separated from the others.
Generation III.Emerald: When it is with its friends or family, its barbs are tucked away to prevent injury. It appears to become nervous if separated from the others.
Generation III.FireRed: The female has a gentle temperament. It emits ultrasonic cries that have the power to befuddle foes.
Generation III.LeafGreen: The female's horns develop slowly. Prefers physical attacks such as clawing and biting.

Generation IV.Diamond: When it senses danger, it raises all the barbs on its body. These barbs grow slower than Nidorino 's.
Generation IV.Pearl: When it senses danger, it raises all the barbs on its body. These barbs grow slower than Nidorino 's.
Generation IV.Platinum: When it senses danger, it raises all the barbs on its body. These barbs grow slower than Nidorino 's.
Generation IV.HeartGold: When feeding its young, it first chews the food into a paste, then spits it out for the offspring.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: It has a calm and caring nature. Because its horn grows slowly, it prefers not to fight.

Generation V.Black: When it senses danger, it raises all the barbs on its body. These barbs grow slower than Nidorino's.
Generation V.White: When it senses danger, it raises all the barbs on its body. These barbs grow slower than Nidorino's.
Generation V.Black 2: When it senses danger, it raises all the barbs on its body. These barbs grow slower than Nidorino's.
Generation V.White 2: When it senses danger, it raises all the barbs on its body. These barbs grow slower than Nidorino's.

Generation VI.X: The female has a gentle temperament. It emits ultrasonic cries that have the power to befuddle foes.
Generation VI.Y: When feeding its young, it first chews the food into a paste, then spits it out for the offspring.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: When Nidorina are with their friends or family, they keep their barbs tucked away to prevent hurting each other. This Pokémon appears to become nervous if separated from the others.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: When Nidorina are with their friends or family, they keep their barbs tucked away to prevent hurting each other. This Pokémon appears to become nervous if separated from the others.

Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: When resting deep in its burrow, its barbs always retract. This is proof that it is relaxed.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: When resting deep in its burrow, its barbs always retract. This is proof that it is relaxed.

Generation VIII.Sword: The horn on its head has atrophied. It's thought that this happens so Nidorina's children won't get poked while their mother is feeding them.
Generation VIII.Shield: If the group is threatened, these Pokémon will band together to assault enemies with a chorus of ultrasonic waves.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: When it senses danger, it raises all the barbs on its body. These barbs grow more slowly than Nidorino's.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: When it senses danger, it raises all the barbs on its body. These barbs grow more slowly than Nidorino's.

Generation I.Red: Safari Zone , Celadon City ( Rocket Game Corner ) Trade Nidorino on Route 11
Generation I.Blue: Safari Zone Trade Nidorino on Route 11

Generation III.FireRed: Safari Zone Trade Nidorino on Route 11

Generation IV.HeartGold: Routes 13 , 14 , and 15 Safari Zone Night (Savannah, default)
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Routes 13 , 14 , and 15 Safari Zone Night (Savannah, default)

Generation VIII.Expansion Pass: Giant's Bed ( Wanderer ) Giant's Bed , Frigid Sea , Ballimere Lake ( Max Raid Battle )
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: Route 221 , Valor Lakefront ( Poké Radar ) Grand Underground - Grassland Cave , Swampy Cave , Riverbank Cave , Dazzling Cave , Still-Water Cavern , Sunlit Cavern , Stargleam Cavern , Bogsunk Cavern (After obtaining the National Pokédex )
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Route 221 , Valor Lakefront ( Poké Radar ) Grand Underground - Grassland Cave , Swampy Cave , Riverbank Cave , Dazzling Cave , Still-Water Cavern , Sunlit Cavern , Stargleam Cavern , Bogsunk Cavern (After obtaining the National Pokédex )
